result.execSummary:
The defendant Dakota K. Steger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Designer Drugs (<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(hm)1.
  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.
Shall obtain a high school diploma, HSED or it's equivalent  Must obtain/maintain full-time employment.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.
